summary: This document is a Know Your Customer (KYC) report for Jeffrey Epstein and associated accounts at Deutsche Bank. It details the relationships, account purposes, and financial profiles of Epstein and his associates, including Harry Beller. The report highlights the introduction of Epstein to Deutsche Bank by Paul Morris and outlines the financial activities related to Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a client of Deutsche Bank, seeking to open new accounts for managing funds related to his homes.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is the relationship manager at Deutsche Bank who introduced Jeffrey Epstein as a client and is responsible for managing his accounts.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Harry Beller is mentioned as a related party to Epstein's accounts, serving as a contact for financial matters.

persons.name: Brian M. Biggar
persons.context: Brian M. Biggar is noted as an approving authority in the KYC process for Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Jacqueline Lightbody
persons.context: Jacqueline Lightbody is mentioned as part of the compliance team that approved the KYC for Epstein.

persons.name: Janice Franklin
persons.context: Janice Franklin is noted for her compliance signature in the KYC process for Epstein.

connections.description: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank.
Harry Beller is associated with Epstein's financial dealings and accounts.

events.title: Client Meeting
events.description: A meeting took place between Paul Morris and Jeffrey Epstein to discuss account management.

events.title: KYC Approval
events.description: The KYC report for Jeffrey Epstein was approved, allowing him to open new accounts at Deutsche Bank.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was introduced to Paul Morris through a mutual friend while Morris was at JPMorgan.
Epstein's accounts at Deutsche Bank are intended to cover costs associated with running his homes.
Harry Beller is identified as an accountant related to Epstein's financial activities.
The KYC process included checks for negative media and criminal offenses, with no significant issues found.
Epstein's estimated net worth is between $100 million and $500 million.
